title: The Giuseppi Logan Quintet 2010
description: The Giuseppi Logan Quintet ~ The Giuseppi Logan Quintet ~ 2010 Tompkins Square Records TSQ2325. http://i2.imageban.ru/out/2017/07/22/487a9bc36103a4ca4c71af9043d116ea.jpg 1 Steppin' 7:57 2 Around 7:33 3 Modes 8:34 4 Over The Rainbow 4:16 5 Bop Dues 7:35 6 Blue Moon 3:01 7 Freddie Freeloader 3:53 8 Love Me Tonight 2:00 Francois Grillot: double bass Warren Smith: drums Dave Burrell: piano Giuseppi Logan: saxophone Matt Lavelle: trumpet, clarinet Tompkins Square Records has once more put its money where its heart is and succeeded in bringing to the surface an American master musician. Saxophonist, pianist, and composer Giuseppi Logan has been completely off the radar since the 1970s after recording a pair of brilliant albums for ESP -- the last of which was 45 years ago! -- until he was discovered playing "Begin the Beguine" in Tompkins Square Park for tips. His story is incredible; in short, after being beset by personal problems, he’d been away from music entirely, homeless, and living in institutions, shelters, and on the streets for decades; he was thought to be dead.... By any measure, The Giuseppi Logan Quintet is an astonishing comeback record because of its sheer virtuosic facility, Logan's composing and playing so finely wrought, it's as if he never left! With this fine band behind him, we can only hope there is much more to come from him. - Thom Jurek, AMG
